dublin_core.dcvalue: The continued poorer health status of rural and remote Australians when compared with their urban counterparts is cause for concern The use of advanced technology to improve access to health care has the potential to assist in addressing this problem Telemedicine is one example of such technology which has advanced rapidly in its capacity to increase access to healthcare services or provide previously unavailable services The important anticipated benefits of greater access to healthcare services are improved health outcomes and more cost effective delivery
Barriers to the up-take of telemedicine in Australia--a view from providers.
